basics.name: Mohammad K. Hussain
basics.label: Software Developer with expertise in web technologies
basics.summary: Passionate about building innovative solutions and contributing to open source projects. Experienced in full-stack development with a focus on modern web technologies.

work.name: Sutra AI (StringVentures)
work.summary: Working on server-side APIs and frontend development
responsibilities: Developed and optimized server-side APIs using Node.js and Express, implementing efficient data handling and caching strategies to improve response times
Implemented dynamic UI components and state management in the Next.js frontend, enhancing user experience and performance
Collaborated with senior developers to integrate RESTful APIs and handle authentication flows using JWT and OAuth for secure user access

work.name: Plone Foundation
work.summary: Created a proof-of-concept for using Volto as a decoupled editor for Plone through the Hydra project
responsibilities: Created a proof-of-concept for using Volto as a decoupled editor for Plone through the Hydra project, allowing frontends built with any framework (React, Vue, etc.) to edit Plone content
Implemented a staged approach for frontend integration with Hydra's bridge, enabling basic editing experiences to full Volto-like inline editing
Developed functionalities for frontends to identify and manage editable blocks within the Hydra editor, including features like block selection, Quanta toolbar integration, and live content updates

work.name: Hybrid Additive Manufacturing (HAM) Lab, IIITDM Jabalpur
work.summary: Designed and developed a responsive landing website for the HAM lab
responsibilities: Worked with a team of 8 to design and develop a responsive landing website for the HAM lab at IIITDM Jabalpur
Conducted user tests and gathered feedback to improve the site's performance and functionality, making it more user-friendly and informative

education.institution: Indian Institute of Information Technology Jabalpur

awards.title: Plone Conference 2024 Speaker
awards.summary: Invited as a speaker at the Plone Conference 2024 in Bras√≠lia, Brazil. Delivered a lightning talk on my GSoC journey with Plone and conducted a live demo showcasing the power of Hydra, a decoupled editor for Plone.

awards.title: Bank of Baroda Hackathon Finalist
awards.summary: Our idea made it into the top 10 in the BoB hackathon.

projects.name: Saveland
projects.description: Linux window management utility for layout preservation across desktop environments
highlights: Developed cross-desktop solution supporting both Hyprland (Wayland) and GNOME (X11) environments
Engineered low-level window manipulation using hyprctl JSON interface and X11 tools (wmctrl/xdotool)
Implemented workspace-aware window tracking with automatic environment detection
Solved complex edge cases for application-specific window management (terminals, browsers, IDEs)
Designed CLI interface with layout versioning and multi-instance application support

projects.name: KYPE
projects.description: A web application for professor reviews
highlights: Developed React-based frontend for a KYPE web app, creating an intuitive and responsive user interface
Utilized MongoDB as the backend database for efficient storage and retrieval of professor reviews, ensuring scalability and optimal performance
Implemented robust features, including user authentication, search functionality, and review submission forms

projects.name: Qissa the Story Bot
projects.description: A Discord bot for collaborative storytelling
highlights: Developed Qissa, a Discord bot using JavaScript and Discord.js
Enables story creation, collaboration, and timeline management within Discord servers
Users can initialize stories, contribute, create timelines, and add events

projects.name: Volto-Hydra
projects.description: A decoupled editor for Plone CMS
highlights: Created a proof-of-concept for using Volto as a decoupled editor for Plone
Implemented a staged approach for frontend integration with Hydra's bridge
Developed functionalities for frontends to identify and manage editable blocks
